page.title: 01AN IMPRESSION OF DANBURY
page.content: Danbury is a small village on a hill standing at a height of 365 feet above sea level,which is one of the highest points in Essex.It lies 5 miles South East of Chelmsford on the A414. If you were to walk through Danbury you would see all the trees growing in and around Danbury. At Eves Corner you might notice the ducks waddling around the reed bordered pond. There is a common in Danbury which is owned by the National Trust and a country park which encompasses a series of ornamental lakes. These are used for leisure by the people of Essex. Although Danbury is today a commuter village it has a long history. Its name may have originated from the Saxon tribe Daenningas. The word "bury" probably comes from the Iron Age ditch which once ringed the hill, which remains a popular vantage point.
